item.title: Lori add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "The human race is a monotonous affair. Most people spend the greatest part of their time working in order to live, and what little freedom remains so fills them with fear that they seek out any and every means to be rid of it." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Lori add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lori add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Luck is a goddess not to be coerced and forcibly wooed by those who seek her favours. From such masterful spirits she turns away. But it happens sometimes that, if we put our hand in hers with the humble trust of a little child, she will have pity on us, and not fail us in our hour of need." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Lori add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "...luck is not to be coerced." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lori add a quote by Sarah Dunant
item.description: "If grace belongs to God, there are those who say that luck belongs to the Devil and that he looks after his own." -- Sarah Dunant

item.title: Lori add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "Luck is the residue of design." -- John Milton

item.title: Lori add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Some luck lies in not getting what you thought you wanted but getting what you have, which once you have it you may be smart enough to see is what you would have wanted had you known. " -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Lori add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "I think we consider too much the luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Lori add a quote by Rex Stout
item.description: "We are all vainer of our luck than of our merits." -- Rex Stout

item.title: Lori add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Life proceeds, it enrages. The untouched ones spend their luck without a thought, believing they deserve it." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Lori add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "If I could, I'd write a huge encyclopedia just about the words luck and coincidence" -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Lori add a quote by Celso Cukierkorn
item.description: "We Jews created the concept of good luck. Luck in Hebrew is mazel, which is not actually a word. It is an acronym for three words: 1. makom = place 2. zman = time 3. lamud = work" -- Celso Cukierkorn

item.title: Lori add a quote by Sakura Tsukuba
item.description: "What i'm saying is that the sun always rises. Fortune's a mix of good and bad luck. Like they say/ good luck and bad luck are strands of the same rope." -- Sakura Tsukuba
